Dear Holly Anderton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/10/24, a staff member at the facility allowed the youth to
smoke a vape and marijuana at a concert. The staff member
used inappropriate language when speaking with the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 2 reported Youth B disclosed Staff 1 saw Youth B smoking
her vape at the concert and did not intervene. She reported Youth
B stated Staff 1 told the youth at the concert to “shake their
asses”. Staff 2 stated this behavior is not like Staff 1. She
reported staff are not allowed to let the youth vape and should be
redirecting and documenting that behavior. Staff 2 reported Youth
B was upset with Staff 1 because Staff 1 reported a concern about
Youth B having a phone. She reported Youth B is upset with
Youth A because she feels Youth A gets treated differently. Staff 2
explained Youth A is allowed to have access to a cell phone when
she is at the community college and work for safety and the ability
to get a hold of staff. She reported Youth A is not allowed to have
the phone while at the facility. Staff 2 reported she talked with
Youth C about how the concert was and Youth C disclosed Staff 1
left the youth alone for some time. Youth C disclosed Staff 1 went
to the bathroom and was gone for a short period while Youth A
and Youth B were dancing to the music. Staff 2 reported Youth C
witnessed Youth A and Youth B smoke off Youth A’s vape but
does not know if Staff 1 saw this.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A reported she went to a concert with Staff 1, Youth B, and
Youth C. She reported she had a great time, and this was the first
concert she ever went to. Youth A reported Staff 1 was with them
the whole time and if anyone had to use the restroom, they would
go together. She reported at the concert she did see other people
smoking and drinking but denied any of that going on in her
section. Youth A denied anyone offering her marijuana or her
smoking marijuana at the concert. She denied having a vape or
2

vaping at the concert. Youth A reported she had used a vape
before being placed at the facility, but she does not vape anymore
because she is on probation. She reported if Staff 1 ever saw
anyone using a vape, she would redirect them about the situation
and take it away. Youth A reported she danced at the concert
because she enjoyed the music. She denied ever being told by
Staff 1 to shake her butt or “twerk.”
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth B reported she told on Staff 1 because Staff 1 “snitched” on
her having a phone. When asked to explain what happened,
Youth B reported at the concert Staff 1 saw Youth A vaping and
did not do anything about it. She reported she went to a concert
with Staff 1, Youth A, and Youth C. Youth B reported she does not
know where Youth A got the vape since she goes to school off-
grounds and has a job she might have gotten from there. She
confirmed Staff 1 did not provide Youth A with the vape. Youth B
reported when she saw Youth A using the vape, she looked at
Staff 1 who was looking at her, so she knew Staff 1 saw Youth A.
She reported Youth A smoked marijuana at the concert from the
people next to them, but she does not know if Staff 1 saw that.
Youth B reported she did use Youth A’s vape but did it so Staff 1
could not see her. She reported Staff 1 also told the youth at the
concern to “twerk”. Youth B reported twerking means to shake
your butt and Youth B felt it was inappropriate for Staff 1 to tell
them to do that. She reported she used to think Staff 1 was a good
staff until she told everyone that she had a phone in her room.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at her school on
September 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth C reported she attended the concert with Staff 1, Youth A,
and Youth B. Youth C reported Staff 1 was gone for about three
minutes in the restroom. She reported during those three minutes,
Youth B offered her to use her vape, but she denied wanting to
use it. She reported she saw Youth A and Youth B use the vape
while Staff 1 was gone. Youth C reported that she did not know
whose vape it was, and the youth never used vapes when Staff 1
was around. She reported at the concert Staff 1 told the three
youth to have fun and enjoy the show. Youth C reported when
Staff 1 said that Youth C added, “Shake our assess and dance.”
She denied Staff 1 ever telling the youth to “twerk” or “shake their
assess”. Youth C reported Youth B just wants Staff 1 to get into
trouble because Staff 1 was the one who told the other staff about
Youth B having a cell phone at the facility.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 reported she brought Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C to a
concert. She reported she told the youth to have fun and dance.
Staff 1 denied ever telling the youth to “twerk” or “shake their
assess” and noted this would be inappropriate to say to the youth.
She reported she maintained line-of-sight supervision of all three
youths and stated that she never saw the youth smoke or vape.
Staff 1 stated if she did see this occur, she would have redirected
the situation right away, reported the situation to supervision, and
completed appropriate documentation. She reported she did run
to the bathroom during the concert and noted the bathroom was
right near where they were sitting.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Administrator reported she provided permission for Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C to go to a concert with Staff 1. She reported
Staff 1 works well with the youth and holds them accountable.
Administrator reported she was present when Youth B disclosed
concerns about Staff 1 allowing Youth A to vape at the concert.
She reported when Youth B was disclosing this concern, she was
mad at Staff 1 for finding out Youth B had a cell phone in her
room.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported she supervises Staff 1 directly. She reported
that Staff 1 is one of the strongest staff at the facility as she has
good rapport with the youth and will hold them accountable.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 has never reported any concerns
about the youth vaping.
Documents Reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been working
at the facility since January 2024 and has not received any
disciplinary actions. Staff 1 was in compliance with all
required trainings and completed Supervision training on
February 22, 2024.
- Facility Youth Development Specialist Procedures
dated 02/2022- This policy states that staff are to use
appropriate, professional language, and avoid the use of
cursing and slang when speaking with the youth. The
expectation is for all staff to speak to the youth with
respect.
4

Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Throughout interviews with
youth and staff there was no findings of Staff 1 having knowledge
of the youth smoking or that she used inappropriate language with
them.
Conclusion Violation not established
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff left 3 youth unattended at a concert while she used the
restroom.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was with them the whole time and if
anyone had to use the restroom, they would go together
Youth C was interviewed face to face at her school on
September 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth C reported she attended the concert with Staff 1, Youth A,
and Youth B. She reported during the concert, Staff 1 notified the
three youth that she was going to run to the bathroom and to stay
in their seats. Youth C reported Staff 1 was gone for about three
minutes.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 reported she maintained line-of-sight supervision of all
three youths and stated that she never saw the youth smoke or
vape. She reported she did run to the bathroom during the concert
and noted the bathroom was right near where they were sitting.
Staff 1 reported she told the three youth that she was going to run
to the bathroom and was only gone for about three minutes. She
reported she thought she could trust the three youth alone for that
short period as the youth earned the privilege to go out on this
outing. Staff 1 reported typically staff are to bring the youth to the
bathroom area with them, but she did not want to take away from
5

the experience as the main performer was on stage when she
needed to use the bathroom. When asked if she would have done
anything differently, she reported she would have brought the
youth to the bathroom with her.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported when she talked to Staff 1 about this open
investigation, Staff 1 did tell her on September 13, 2024, that she
left the youth for a short time to use the restroom at the concert.
Documents Reviewed:
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has been working
at the facility since January 2024 and has not received any
disciplinary actions. Staff 1 was in compliance with all
required trainings and completed Supervision training on
February 22, 2024.
- Facility Youth Supervision Procedure dated 07/2023-
This procedure notes, “Activities involving more than one
youth must be closely monitored. The responsible staff
person must be in close physical proximity and able to
observe all participants engaging in the activity and monitor
interactions.”
Analysis The facility is found in violations of Staff 1 not following the facility
supervision policy as it was found she left the youth alone for a
few minutes at the concert while she used the bathroom.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
